result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kevin Derek Larson appeared by phone.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video for Kevin Derek Larson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Dadoun is heard and they're prepared to move forward with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - Sgt P. Baumgartner, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Dadoun 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Dadoun objects to bind over. Attorney Dadoun moves to dismiss count 2. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Dadoun raises motion to waive time limits. 
10:32 AM Information has been filed. 
Attorney Dadoun waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the two counts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Court states we need to set a preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kevin Derek Larson in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 


Court approves the appointment of an attorney. $50.00 per month towards the cost of the court appointed attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:59 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kevin Derek Larson in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Judge Rider appeared by video. 


Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Bailiff provided defendant with a copy of the public defender information.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:28 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kevin D Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. requests $250.00 cash bond; not possess/consume any controlled substances; submit to testing at request of L.E.
     Def. asks for signature bond; works at Trane in La Crosse.
     D.A. comments.
     Court orders signature bond of $500.00; not possess/consume any controlled substances unless specifically prescribed; to submit to UAs by L.E. as requested; if positive or refused, to submit to a blood draw.
     Def. states understanding.  Court advises of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 1:34 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant not to possess/consume any controlled substances unless specifically prescribed; to submit to UAs by L.E. as requested; if positive or refused, to submit to a blood draw.
